cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 345 miles W of Key West, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to turn north-northeast, cross the Florida Big-Bend on Thursday, then accelerate northeast just offshore the U.S. southeast and Mid-Atlantic coast before recurving well east of New England.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend coast between Anclote River and Indian Pass

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch: Anclote River to Indian Pass, FL.  Tropical Storm Watch: west of Indian Pass to the Walton/Bay County line, FL.
weather_observation.warning_coast: None in effect as of this advisory
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Gulf coast, then potentially Georgia, South Carolina and North Carolina coasts with offshore impacts extending northward toward the Mid-Atlantic and New England waters.
weather_observation.wind: Breezy northeast winds possible (20–30 kt gusts) late Saturday as the center passes well offshore.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected; water level changes less than 1 ft.
weather_observation.rainfall: Light to moderate rain bands possible, generally 1–2 inches or less.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents along Atlantic beaches.
